column4: ideas where to find things like tun-source, bcm4400-source, thinkpad-source and madwifi-source? looks like the fresh ubuntu does not like to let me compile the modules because the source keeps on missing
apt-get source packagename
i know about that, i just seem to be missing the sources. in other words: repositories do not seem to have them
..and now that i remember, they are all enabled in sources.list
You need to make sure that you have the deb-src repositories for each of your normal deb lines
main, universe, restricted and multiverse are all enabled for both deb and deb-src. done apt-get update too
Give me a package name that you can't get the source for, I want to take a look.
Are you doing: apt-get source tun-source? or apt-get source tun?
sorry, phone....
apt-get source tun and apt-get source tun-source both error out "cannot find a source package for tun[-source]"
Are you sure that those are proper package names? The only one that I can see that should work is thinkpad-source (but in that case, its just a regular package)
apt-get install thinkpad-source "cannot find package thinpad-source" and the same with all the others too. even modules-assistant reports the same
they should be the proper names.... i *could* do a straight compile from raw sources but i am not really in a mood for htat kind of screwing around this time
I ask because I dont see them at all.
so it is not only me this time... hmm... tun i absolutely need, acx100, ipw2200, madwifi and thinkpad would be nice
Have you looked in the kernel sources?
iirc they all are external thingies. at least thinkpad, madwifi and tun are
Then I'm not really sure, sorry :/
the funny thing is that modules-assistant knows them by those names but it cannot find the sources. could they be in repositories for older releases?
They are probably in the linux-restricted-modules or linux-ubuntu-modules packages for your kernel.
restricted modules installed but tun. thinkpad and madwifi are all fully gpl... strange
make-kpkg modules_image begins to sound a nice idea with some pure raw sources off the net
